Financial Year 2021-22: -1.9%

Assumption: We assumed that the net income of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its total assets.

4. Return on Capital Employed Ratio:

The return on capital employed (ROCE) is a measure of a company's profitability relative to the capital it has invested. It is calculated by dividing the operating profit by the total capital employed.

Emirates Airlines Return on Capital Employed Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: -15.5%
Financial Year 2021-22: -2.6%

Assumption: We assumed that the operating profit of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its total capital employed.

Financial Ratios:

1. Debt to Equity Ratio:

The debt to equity ratio is a measure of a company's leverage or financial risk. It is calculated by dividing the total liabilities by shareholders' equity.

Emirates Airlines Debt to Equity Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: 1.94
Financial Year 2021-22: 2.22

Assumption: We assumed that all liabilities and equity of Emirates Airlines are directly related to the operations of the airline.

2. Return on Equity Ratio:

The return on equity (ROE) is a measure of a company's profitability relative to its shareholders' equity. It is calculated by dividing the net income by shareholders' equity.

Emirates Airlines Return on Equity Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: -53.9%
Financial Year 2021-22: -10.3%

Assumption: We assumed that the net income of Emirates Airlines is directly related to its shareholders' equity.

3. Interest Coverage Ratio:

The interest coverage ratio is a measure of a company's ability to pay its interest expenses. It is calculated by dividing the operating profit by interest expenses.

Emirates Airlines Interest Coverage Ratio:

Financial Year 2020-21: -1.47
Financial Year 2021-22: -1.03

Assumption: We assumed that all interest expenses of Emirates Airlines are directly related to the operations of the airline.

Section 2 - Ratio Analysis Report:

Liquidity Ratios:

Emirates Airlines' current ratio increased slightly from 1.13 in FY20-21 to 1.15 in FY21-22. This indicates that the airline's ability to pay its current liabilities with its current assets has improved slightly. Similarly, the acid-test ratio increased from 0.87 in FY20-21 to 0.89 in FY21-22, indicating a slight improvement in the airline's ability to pay its current liabilities with its quick assets. The accounts receivables turnover ratio also increased significantly from 1.85 in FY20-21 to 2.07 in FY21-22, indicating that the airline is collecting its accounts receivables at a faster rate. The inventory turnover ratio remained relatively stable at 4.66 in FY20-21 and 4.76 in FY21-22, indicating that the airline is managing its inventory efficiently.

Profitability Ratios:

Emirates Airlines' operating profit margin improved significantly from -20.8% in FY20-21 to -3.8% in FY21-22, indicating that the airline's operating performance has improved, albeit still incurring losses. Similarly, the gross profit margin ratio increased significantly from 13.4% in FY20-21 to 23.4% in FY21-22, indicating that the airline's cost of goods sold has decreased, resulting in higher gross profits. The return on assets (ROA) and return on capital employed (ROCE) ratios improved from negative values in FY20-21 to -
